div.div: IF BURBERRY COULD MAKE A COMEBACK...
So you want to rebrand a word. It’s hard to think of a more difficult rebranding project than “jihad.”

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VSuaAL&via=Digg&text=Can 'Jihad' Be Rebranded?

div.a: Inside The Aurora Shooter's Booby-Trapped Apartment

div.div: New details have arisen about the elaborate and deadly traps accused Aurora shooter James Holmes allegedly set in his apartment in a failed attempt to divert police away from the theater.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UHJ0eD&via=Digg&text=Inside The Aurora Shooter's Booby-Trapped Apartment

div.a: Florida Everglades To Host Python-Killing Contest

div.div: Burmese pythons have overrun the Florida everglades, eating smaller species and throwing off the balance of the local ecosystem there. Now the state is declaring open season on the snakes.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VT2P1p&via=Digg&text=Florida Everglades To Host Python-Killing Contest

div.a: Trail Of Cheetos Leads Police To Teenage Thief

div.div: A teenager who had just robbed a local store was caught after police followed a trail of Cheetos from the scene which lead them to the culprit's hideout.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UXfEdb&via=Digg&text=Trail Of Cheetos Leads Police To Teenage Thief

div.a: Adobe Almost Does Something Amazing By Accident

div.div: It seemed like an intriguing deal. An old version of Adobe Creative Suite—the 2005 vintage CS2, to be precise—became freely downloadable from Adobe, with nothing more than a free-to-create Adobe ID required from users.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UJMA87&via=Digg&text=Adobe Almost Does Something Amazing By Accident

div.a: The $17K Linux-Powered Auto-Aiming Rifle Has Arrived

div.div: This rifle will is fitted with an advanced computerized scope that looks like something out of "The Terminator."

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UKOLYT&via=Digg&text=The $17K Linux-Powered Auto-Aiming Rifle Has Arrived

div.a: How I Turned My Sex Life Into An Exercise Routine

div.div: We've all thought it before: "Why are you doing (insert current gym activity) when you could be having sex?" One woman decided to just go for it. Here's what she learned.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/11ckMyq&via=Digg&text=How I Turned My Sex Life Into An Exercise Routine

div.a: How Monopoly Games Helped Allied POWs Escape During World War II

div.div: Even trivial changes to a trivial board game can shift the course of history.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/ZsTXRv&via=Digg&text=How Monopoly Games Helped Allied POWs Escape During World War II

div.div: In the wake of the Newtown shooting, Public Policy Polling has done a bit of work.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/ULus1m&via=Digg&text=27% Think Teachers Should Carry Guns

div.a: This Cardboard Cockroach Is The World's Second-Fastest Robot

div.div: As if regular cockroaches weren’t awful enough, a professor at University of California, Berkley has created the VELOCIRoACH, a six-legged cardboard robot modeled on roach anatomy that can run at 3.2 meters per second–26 times the length of its body–making it the second-fastest self-propelled robot on record.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WzBEI3&via=Digg&text=This Cardboard Cockroach Is The World's Second-Fastest Robot

div.a: Want To Colonize Mars? Applications Now Being Accepted

div.div: Looking for an out-of-this-world experience? Mars One, a non-profit agency, is accepting applications for astronauts to help build the first settlement on the red planet in 2023.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/ULRx43&via=Digg&text=Want To Colonize Mars? Applications Now Being Accepted

div.a: 23 Reasons Why Facebook Couples Are The Worst

div.div: Nobody cares about your one month anniversary. NOBODY. CARES.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XkE681&via=Digg&text=23 Reasons Why Facebook Couples Are The Worst

div.div: SOMEONE INVENT NEW REFS FOR 'SHARK TANK'
The media mogul and Dallas Mavericks owner was fined $50,000 for his Jan. 5 tweet criticizing NBA officiating, according to USA Today and other news outlets.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/ZsiDcK&via=Digg&text=Tweet Costs Mark Cuban $50,000

div.div: BALD GUYS NEVER GET ELECTED THOUGH

div.a: This Guy May Be The Next President Of The Czech Republic

div.div: Vladimir Franz, an opera composer and painter, is tattooed from head to toe, his face a warrior-like mix of blue, green and red. He's also running in a surprising third place ahead of this week's Czech presidential elections.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WywCeS&via=Digg&text=This Guy May Be The Next President Of The Czech Republic

div.div: IT'LL TAKE A LOT OF BALLS
An arcade entrepreneur has a plan to resuscitate the dying pastime—with a little help from the Wizard of Oz.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WtGtTl&via=Digg&text=Can This Man Save Pinball?

div.a: What It's Like To Experience New Technology After 25 Years In Jail

div.div: Regardless of how much I read, I wouldn't grasp the power of technology until I started using it. Forget the power, I don't even understand the language of technology.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RGi3t8&via=Digg&text=What It's Like To Experience New Technology After 25 Years In Jail

div.a: VCs Think My Boobs Need An Algorithm

div.div: VCs think my boobs need an algorithm. My boobs don’t need an algorithm. If that’s not enough, VCs also think that women need a bra subscription.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RGwgGx&via=Digg&text=VCs Think My Boobs Need An Algorithm

div.div: In September of last year, a report was released stating that Mt Fuji’s magma chamber pressure had risen to a worrisome 1.6 megapascals, which is estimated to be higher than when it last erupted.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RFdGOQ&via=Digg&text=Mt. Fuji To Erupt By 2015?

div.a: Taylor Swift’s Love Life By The Numbers

div.div: R.I.P., Haylor. Taylor Swift and One Direction crooner Harry Styles broke up this week, adding another notch to the country singer’s belt. A look at Swift’s relationships, through the stats and facts.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/ZoMjYo&via=Digg&text=Taylor Swift’s Love Life By The Numbers

div.a: The Right Way To Destroy Sensitive Data

div.div: A company gives a batch of old computers to a recycler but neglects to delete the data stored on them. A few months later the hard drives—full of Social Security numbers, credit-card information, and corporate secrets—are for sale on EBay or a street corner in Ghana. It’s a corporate nightmare. And it’s an all-too-common scenario with e-waste.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VNx9eh&via=Digg&text=The Right Way To Destroy Sensitive Data

div.a: The Best Thing About A Treasury Secretary Jack Lew

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SkvaSl&via=Digg&text=The Best Thing About A Treasury Secretary Jack Lew

div.div: Children's literature is about the wonder of discovering new worlds, the power of imagination, and the all the little triumphs and defeats that make up a life. It's also an excellent place to find hypothetical questions that test the laws of physics.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VhlnMa&via=Digg&text=Roald Dahl Was Wrong

div.a: Someone Paid $1,200 For A Single Bottle Of White House Homebrew

div.div: We guess that people are still really, really interested in getting a taste of President Obama's Honey Ale: One report now shows that a group of Minnesotans paid $1,200 for a single bottle.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VHCV1p&via=Digg&text=Someone Paid $1,200 For A Single Bottle Of White House Homebrew

div.a: Taliban Claims To Have Shot Down 16 Drones

div.div: In the Taliban’s version of a “Year in Jihad” propaganda email to the media, they claimed to have shot down 16 remotely piloted aircraft in 2012.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/13j27Q9&via=Digg&text=Taliban Claims To Have Shot Down 16 Drones

div.a: North Korea Follows Only One American On Twitter - This Guy

div.div: How Jimmy Dushku, 25-year-old globetrotting investor and Coldplay superfan, became Pyongyang's only true Twitter friend—and the backlash that followed.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UAglGS&via=Digg&text=North Korea Follows Only One American On Twitter - This Guy

div.a: Why Female Pop Stars Are Better At Singing About Sex

div.div: Unlike their male counterparts, they know how to be coy.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UGf8D3&via=Digg&text=Why Female Pop Stars Are Better At Singing About Sex

div.a: Apple Refuses To Make The One Mobile Device Taking Over The World

div.div: One category of mobile device will blow away all others in the pace of its growth, expanding 70% in each of the next three years and yielding a $135 billion market by the end of 2015. It’s called a phablet.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/ZGzygD&via=Digg&text=Apple Refuses To Make The One Mobile Device Taking Over The World

div.a: What Did Google Earth Spot In The Chinese Desert?

div.div: Late last month, former CIA analyst Allen Thomson was clicking through a space news website when he noticed a story about a new orbital tracking site being built near the small city of Kashgar in southwestern China. Curious, he went to Google Earth to find it. He poked around for a while, with no luck. Then he came across something kind of weird.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VFO2ry&via=Digg&text=What Did Google Earth Spot In The Chinese Desert?
